body.p:
Brandenburg
June 11 1861
Gov. Magoffin Pres.
Military Board.
Dear Sir

I have organised a cavalry Company in this county who have been duly sworn in & have in my possession the certificates &c from the County Judge. all in due conformity to law. & would immediately proceed to Frankfort for arms -- but from a late card published by your board. learn that certain forms &c. will be agreed upon & forwarded to the Captains of the various companies or could be had on application. My Company is composed of the best & most substantial men of our county -- our late representative being of the number. Can we get arms for a cavalry Company. if so I will come up immediately. our county is immediately on the border & one of the most exposed & has been threatened heretofore with invasion (during the Bell incitements). Being a brother of your friend Major Alexander of the U. S. Army, I particularly desire your aid in arming us at once. I have a bond duly executed with ample security & if it is necessary for any other papers to be furnished by your board please send them to me at once. -- an immediate ans desired -- (we want good arms.)
